Therefore, the patient may deny placement of the feeding tube. Capacity refers to a patient’s ability to make decisions based on an understanding of the situation, the risks and benefits of treatment options, and the ability to communicate their wishes. If the patient lacked capacity, then the healthcare proxy would be contacted or the state would determine whether to place the feeding tube. The ethics committee would only be involved if there was a disagreement among the medical team, patient, or patient’s family regarding ethical issues related to the patient’s care.
